faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Here are answers to common questions
faq.question1: Why should I start a business in Dubai?
faq.answer1: Dubai offers tax advantages, a stable economy, and a strategic location.
faq.question2: How to open a business in Dubai?
faq.answer2: Choose a zone, company type, get a license, and open a bank account.
faq.question3: What types of business licenses are available in Dubai?
faq.answer3: Commercial, professional, and industrial — depending on the business activity.
faq.question4: What are the main steps to starting a company in Dubai?
faq.answer4: Choose jurisdiction, register the company, get licensed, and open a bank account.
faq.question5: How much does it cost to start a business in Dubai?
faq.answer5: Cost depends on zone and activity type, starting from $5,000.
faq.question6: Can foreigners own 100% of their business in Dubai?
faq.answer6: Yes, in free zones and in some mainland cases.

swiper.titleh2: How the company setup process works — step by step

items.title: Free Consultation
items.description: We start with a consultation to understand your goals and objectives. We discuss which business structures suit you best and suggest the optimal option for registration. You’ll receive all the information you need to make a decision.

items.title: Personalized Solution
items.description: Based on the consultation, we develop a tailored plan that meets your needs. We select the right license, prepare documents, and set deadlines. All actions are agreed upon with you at each step.

items.title: Document Collection & Preparation
items.description: We collect and verify all necessary documents to ensure your business is registered without delays. We complete all forms, applications, and notarize them if needed.

items.title: Company Registration
items.description: Once documents are ready, we submit them to the appropriate authorities for registration. We monitor the process and keep you updated at every stage. In the end, you receive your license and official confirmations.

items.title: Post-Registration Support
items.description: After registration, we continue to support you. We help open a bank account, arrange visas for staff, and provide accounting and legal assistance. Your business will grow without extra hassle.

servicesPage.title: Full range of services for starting and developing a business in the UAE

items.title: Company Registration in UAE
items.content: We help register businesses in any jurisdiction: Mainland, Free Zone or Offshore. We provide consultation, prepare documents and fully support the process until obtaining the registration certificate.

items.title: Bank Account Opening
items.content: We support you at all stages of opening corporate and personal accounts in UAE banks. We help choose the right bank, prepare documents and pass the interview.

items.title: License Acquisition
items.content: We arrange obtaining all types of business licenses: commercial, professional, industrial and freelance. We handle interactions with regulatory authorities and document processing.

items.title: Virtual Offices and Coworking
items.content: We provide legal addresses, help rent virtual offices, coworking spaces and physical spaces for your business that meet the requirements of your chosen license.

items.title: Tax Consulting
items.content: We consult on UAE tax legislation, including VAT system registration, planning and compliance with all obligations to government authorities.

items.title: Accounting Support
items.content: We provide professional accounting services: reporting, financial analysis, document preparation and support during audits. Everything strictly according to legal requirements.

items.title: Visas for Investors and Employees
items.content: We assist in obtaining residence visas for business owners, employees and their family members. We help with Emirates ID, medical certificates and visa renewals.

items.title: Full Business Support
items.content: Comprehensive support at every stage: from idea to scaling. We handle all administrative and organizational matters so you can focus on growing your business.

blog2.h2: How to Start a Business in Dubai: Step-by-Step Guide
blog2.name: Ritesh Sharma
blog2.dubaiText: Dubai is one of the most attractive cities for doing business thanks to its flexible economy, low taxes, and favorable legal system. In this article, we’ll walk you through how to open a business in Dubai step by step, what to watch out for, and what to avoid.
blog2.three: There are three main types of registration in the UAE:
blog2.free: Free Zone — beneficial for foreign entrepreneurs, allows 100% ownership of the business.
blog2.mainland: Mainland — suitable if you want to work directly with local companies and government entities.
blog2.offshore: Offshore — for international operations and tax planning, but not suitable for operating within the UAE.
blog2.text: Every business needs a license, which depends on the field of activity:
blog2.div5: It’s important to specify the correct field, otherwise you may face rejections or limitations.
blog2.blue3: Step 3: Choose a Free Zone or Regulatory Authority
blog2.text1: If you choose a Free Zone, you’ll need to determine which zone suits your business. For example:
blog2.blue5: Step 5: Submit Application and Get a License
blog2.text12: You submit documents online or via a registered agent. Processing time: from 3 to 15 business days. After that, you receive your license and can start operations.
blog2.bank: After registration, you can open a corporate bank account and apply for an investor visa, as well as employee visas if you plan to hire staff.

faqPage.title1: Everything You Wanted to Know — in One Place
faqPage.subtitle: We’ve collected answers to the most frequently asked questions from our clients. If you didn’t find the information you need — contact us and we’ll be happy to help.
faqPage.description: We’ll be happy to consult you personally.

items.question: 1. Can a foreigner start a business in Dubai?
items.answer: Yes, foreigners can own 100% of a business in free economic zones and in several mainland jurisdictions.

items.question: 2. How long does it take to register a company?
items.answer: The process takes from 3 to 15 working days depending on the jurisdiction and the documents provided.

items.question: 3. What documents are required to open a company?
items.answer: Usually a passport copy, visa, business plan, and proof of address are required.

items.question: 4. What business zones exist in the UAE?
items.answer: Free zones, mainland, and offshore — each with its own rules and benefits.

items.question: 5. Is a local partner required?
items.answer: Not in free zones. In some mainland jurisdictions — yes, but 100% foreign ownership is often possible.

items.question: 6. Can I open a business remotely?
items.answer: Yes, registration is possible remotely via online document submission and video verification.

items.question: 7. Is it mandatory to rent an office?
items.answer: Some free zones offer virtual offices, while others require a physical space.

items.question: 8. Can I get a visa when opening a company?
items.answer: Yes, as a business owner you can apply for a UAE residence visa.

items.question: 9. What types of licenses are available?
items.answer: Commercial, professional, and industrial — depending on your activity.

items.question: 10. What are the typical setup costs?
items.answer: Costs vary by zone and activity but usually start from $3,500–$5,000.
